name: Recreation of an artwork by Herbert W. Franke
description: This piece recreates Herbert W. Franke's minimalist artwork with a dynamic twist. It incorporates physics simulation to animate squares that bounce around the canvas. Each square is influenced by gravity and friction, giving it a natural movement effect. The squares are randomly sized and colored.

name: Recreation of an artwork by Herbert W. Franke. Variation 1
description: This piece is a recreation inspired by Herbert W. Franke's artwork, featuring a particle system that continuously evolves. Each particle, represented as a square, starts from the center of the canvas and moves outward.

name: Recreation of an artwork by Herbert W. Franke. Variation 2
description: This piece is a recreaction inspired by Herbert W Franke's artwork. It features static cherries and randomly generated squares that move and fade over time.

name: Recreation of an artwork by Herbert W. Franke
description: I chose to start by recreating this artwork by Herbert W. Franke because its minimalist design made it a fitting choice for my first project. In this artwork, I use a for loop and randomization to generate squares at random positions and sizes on the canvas.

name: Recreation of an artwork by Herbert W. Franke. Variation 1
description: In the first variation of this artwork I decided to add a random stroke color to make the design more vivid.

name: Recreation of an artwork by Herbert W. Franke. Variation 2
description: For the second variation, I use push() and pop() along with translate() and rotate() to apply random rotations to squares.

name: Recreation of an artwork by Herbert W. Franke. Variation 3
description: In the third variation, I decided to utilize a counter to progressively influence the position of the squares, creating a dynamic effect where the squares shift over time.

name: Recreation of an artwork by Peter Saville
description: I chose to recreate this artwork by Peter Saville because it graces the cover of a Joy Division album I like. Additionally, I wanted to recreate something more complicated than the first artwork. In this artwork, I use a for loop with Perlin noise to generate wavy lines with greater amplitude in the center and diminish towards the edges.

name: Recreation of an artwork by Peter Saville. Variation 1
description: In the first variation of this artwork I decided to add a counter to add a sense of movement

name: Recreation of an artwork by Peter Saville. Variation 2
description: In the second variation of this artwork I decided to add a random stroke color to make the design more vivid.

name: Recreation of an artwork by Peter Saville. Variation 3
description: In the third variation, I added a random stroke weight.

name: Recreation of an artwork by Vera Molnár
description: In this artwork, I recreated a design by Vera Molnár by arranging multiple layers of rectangles in a grid pattern. Each rectangle's size decreases progressively with each layer, and they are filled with random shades of magenta.

name: Recreation of an artwork by Vera Molnár. Variation 1.
description: In the first variation of this artwork, I added transparency to the fill color of each rectangle by incorporating an alpha value.

name: Recreation of an artwork by Vera Molnár. Variation 2.
description: In the second variation of this artwork, I decided to remove the noLoop() function to give the piece a psychedelic effect through continuous animation.

name: Recreation of an artwork by Vera Molnár. Variation 3.
description: In the third variation of this artwork, I decided apply a random rotation to each rectangle by using push() and pop() to isolate the transformation, which results in rectangles being drawn at different angles around their center.
